page.title: 12WIVELSCOMBE ESTATE:TREMATON
page.content: In the land around Wivelscombe are the remains of a disused quarry. Apart from slate, this also supplied ochre dye. There would have been three houses next to the quarry, which having been derelict for 80 years is now thought by some to be haunted. There would have been an old railway track on a pulley system serving this industry. Nearby are the remains of a quay where barges used to take the goods from the railway by river to the nearby sea ports. The present owners hope to recover the quarry as a garden adding it to their existing grounds. Although these cover several acres divided up into many fields, each field has its own name. Maps of the estate show a disused chapel but there is no proof of this use and the building may even have been a pigsty.
